The assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand: If I could change one historical event, it would be the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand. This event triggered World War I, which resulted in the deaths of millions of people and had a lasting impact on the world.

The discovery of penicillin: If I could change one historical event, it would be the discovery of penicillin. Penicillin is a powerful antibiotic that has saved countless lives and revolutionized the field of medicine.

The invention of the internet: If I could change one historical event, it would be the invention of the internet. The internet has transformed the way we communicate, access information, and conduct business.

The invention of the steam engine: If I could change one historical event, it would be the invention of the steam engine. The steam engine revolutionized transportation and industry, leading to the Industrial Revolution and the development of modern society.

The assassination of President John F. Kennedy: If I could change one historical event, it would be the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. This event had a profound impact on American politics and society.
